author: VNExplorer
title: Four Covid deaths, 702 fresh cases in a day
text:
Four Covid deaths, 702 fresh cases in a day
NEW DELHI: India recorded four more deaths due to Covid-19 in one day — one each from Karnataka, Kerala, Bengal and Delhi — while the daily tally of infections stood at 702, the health ministry said.
On December 22, India had recorded 752 new cases of Covid-19 in a day. As reported by TOI on Thursday, the two deaths reported in Maharashtra were added to its tally of Wednesday.
The current surge in Covid-19 cases is suspected to be caused by JN.1, a new sub-variant of SARS-CoV2, which was first detected in Kerala in India on December 8. It has been detected in eight other states of Gujarat, Karnataka, Goa, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, & Delhi.
Senior health ministry officials said though cases have gone up, very few cases are requiring hospitalisation as symptoms are mild in most Covid-19 cases now. “The deaths were attributed to Covid-19 people with pre-existing co-morbidities,” said an official.
The daily number of infections were in lakhs at the peak of the pandemic, which began in early 2020 and has seen over 4.5 crore people getting infected and over 5.3 lakh deaths in about four years across the country. The national recovery rate was 98.8%, as per the health ministry’s website. Over 220 crore doses of Covid vaccines have so far been administered in the country.
For more news like this visit TOI. Get all the Latest News, City News, India News, Business News, and Sports News. For Entertainment News, TV News, and Lifestyle Tips visit Etimes

author: VNExplorer
title: Trump claims he has "great support" among Black and Latino voters because of his mugshot
text: Donald Trump Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images Donald Trump chimed in by phone to tell Black supporters that his mugshot, taken in Fulton County jail when he was indicted by District Attorney Fani Willis on election racketeering charges, has been followed by a supposed surge in Black and Latino support for his campaign. "But since this has happened, like the mugshot, the mugshot is the best," he bragged. "It just beat Elvis Presley and Frank Sinatra by a lot. By the way, beat it by a lot. But that’s the number one mugshot of all time." The occasion for Trump's remarks was a "Black Americans for Trump" event at a barbershop in Atlanta, the largest city in the swing state of Georgia, where Biden's 12,000-vote victory in 2020 was sealed with his 88% support among Black voters. Trump, hoping to cut into the deficit, enlisted Rep. Byron Donalds, R-Fla., and former Housing and Urban Development Secretary Ben Carson to stump for him at the barbershop while he attended via phone call. According to the New York Times, the event was sparsely attended, with reporters and staff members far outnumbering voters and potential supporters. Trump, seeming to imply that Black and Latino voters might relate to a candidate facing a criminal indictment, continued to express awe that the mugshot has caused his support among them to "skyrocket." "It’s been amazing, really been amazing. It’s it’s been actually very nice to see," he said, as Donalds and Carson listened stoically. "You know, in one way, you say, gee, isn’t not too bad. But the truth is, it’s really a lovely thing when I see that we have great support now in the Black community and in the Hispanic community." Trump's remarks echo those from conservative media personalities, who have been suggesting that the former president's mugshot and indeed criminal convictions would make him more popular among minority voters. Fox News' Jesse Waters claimed to know what people were saying on "the streets," and his impression was that the mugshot made Trump "a martyr" and "a sympathetic character in Black America."

author: EFE
title: Hallan muerto a un piloto español en una habitación de un hotel en Paraguay
text:
En Asunción
Hallan muerto a un piloto español en una habitación de un hotel en Paraguay
EFE
Un piloto de nacionalidad española fue hallado sin vida en la habitación de un hotel en Asunción, la capital de Paraguay, por presunta "muerte súbita", lo que ocasionó la cancelación de un vuelo con destino a Madrid, informó este miércoles la Policía, que investiga el hecho.
El jefe de la Comisaría Sexta de Asunción, José Santacruz, declaró a EFE que la mañana del martes recibieron una alerta del sistema de emergencia 911 sobre un piloto español que "amaneció sin signos de vida" en su habitación de hotel.
El hombre, de 47 años, estaba hospedado junto a diez tripulantes de un vuelo, quienes "se percataron que no se levantaba" y alertaron a los encargados del establecimiento, relató Santacruz.
Integrantes de la Policía y del Ministerio Público acudieron a atender el llamado, así como personal de salud que intentó reanimar al hombre sin éxito.
Santacruz indicó que el médico forense dispuso el traslado del cuerpo a una morgue judicial, donde, aseguró, se le practicarán "algunos análisis" que permitan corroborar "las circunstancias de la muerte".
El director de aeropuertos de la Dirección Nacional de Aeronáutica Civil (Dinac), Rubén Aguilar, declaró a la radio Monumental que un vuelo de la aerolínea Air Europa que debía despegar el martes del Aeropuerto Internacional Silvio Pettirossi, que sirve a Asunción, con destino a Madrid "se canceló".
La compañía aérea justificó la demora por un "motivo operacional", agregó Aguilar, que no se refirió a la muerte del piloto.
Sin embargo, medios locales indicaron que el fallecido estaba vinculado con la aerolínea española.

author: WMBB-TV Staff
title: Fire officials offer tips for safe fireworks handling this 4th of July | mypanhandle.com
text: BAY COUNTY, Fla. ( [WMBB](https://www.mypanhandle.com/news/local-news/bay-county/fire-officials-offer-tips-for-safe-fireworks-handling-this-4th-of-july/)) – Many people will be preparing for the 4th of July holiday which is just 2 weeks away. Fire officials are warning residents about the dangers of handling their own fireworks. There are some important tips you should know to help keep you and your family safe. While thousands will go out to public firework viewings to celebrate Independence Day, some may opt for fireworks at home. If this is the case officials are offering some tips to avoid a fire while having fun. Andy Biondo from the Office of Financial Services said it’s important to stay vigilant while handling the fireworks. “People are easily distracted with phones and everything, and you’re fighting off bombs in essence. So you must be very careful taking care of those types of things,” Biondo said. He also said having a bucket of water handy and only lighting fireworks in an open area are good ways to prevent a fire from breaking out. Howard Demro from the Panama City Fire Department said what you do after the fireworks is just as important as the preparation. “They’re really hot after you get done using them. And if you dispose of them too quickly in your trash can, you could most likely have a trash can fire later in the night if you’re not careful. So we recommend to put them in a five-gallon bucket of water,” Fire Prevention Lt. Howard Demro said. Demro also said small children should be away from any fireworks. “We don’t want any kids to be lighting any fireworks this holiday. We asked that only adults be near and around the fireworks when they’re being lit and they’re the only ones that are lighting fireworks off,” Demro said. Fire officials warn residents to practice caution when using fireworks but they also want to remind residents to not forget about their furry friends. Additionally, officials said you should always make sure your pets are in a safe space away from the fireworks before you begin lighting them. He also suggests keeping pets inside during the fireworks. Officials said residents should take advantage of public firework showings where viewers are kept a safe distance away from the fireworks. In the month around the 4th of July 2022, 11 people died in fireworks-related incidents, 5 because they misused the fireworks, and more than 10,000 people were injured using fireworks.

author: CJ
title: El Tribunal de Justicia de Galicia condena al Sergas por la vulneración del derecho a la intimidad de un paciente
text:
El Tribunal de Justicia de Galicia condena al Sergas por la vulneración del derecho a la intimidad de un paciente
Accedieron a su historial clínico de forma indebida y deberán indemnizarle con 9.000 euros
La sección primera de la Sala de lo Contencioso-administrativo del Tribunal Superior de Justicia de Galicia (TSXG) ha condenado al Servicio Gallego de Salud (Sergas) a indemnizar con 9.000 euros a un auxiliar administrativo del Sergas, quien desempeñaba su trabajo en el Complejo Hospitalario Universitario de Santiago de Compostela (CHUS), por deficiente funcionamiento de sus servicios públicos, debido a que el 25 de septiembre de 2019 accedieron de forma indebida a su historial clínico.
La Sala considera probado que “una o varias personas que no pudieron ser identificadas accedieron a su historial clínico utilizando la tarjeta y número de PIN personal del jefe de aquel servicio, que, al parecer, la dejaba introducida y activada, de modo permanente, en el ordenador, siendo el PIN conocido por la mayor parte de los trabajadores del servicio”.
De esta forma, ha estimado el recurso de apelación interpuesto por el afectado y ha revocado la sentencia apelada, dictada por el Juzgado de lo Contencioso-administrativo número 1 de Santiago de Compostela, la cual fijó la indemnización en 5.000 euros.
El tribunal explica en la resolución que considera insuficiente esa cantidad para reparar el daño producido, “máxime cuando la Administración no ha agotado la investigación a que venía obligada por la reprobable actitud del jefe del servicio y de la persona o personas que accedieron indebidamente al historial clínico del actor, lo que no hubiera resultado difícil, dado el escaso número de trabajadores en el servicio”.
Por ello, explica que considera “más ajustada a la gravedad del hecho, a la sorprendente postura de la Administración, tratando de justificar lo injustificable, al daño moral producido al actor y a la difusión de sus datos médicos ilegítimamente obtenidos, fijar una indemnización, por todos los conceptos, incluidos intereses legales, por importe de 9.000 euros”.
